nodes.text: Star Wars: Hunters is an upcoming free-to-play competitive arena combat video game from NaturalMotion and BossAlien, as well as another unknown third studio, and edited by Zynga and Lucasfilm Games. It is scheduled for release in late 2021 on mobile devices and Nintendo Switch, with a soft launch in early summer.

Set after the fall of the Galactic Empire, Star Wars: Hunters will bring players together in thrilling, team-based multiplayer battles. Select from a diverse cast of new characters, including daring Bounty Hunters, heroes of the Rebellion and Imperial stormtroopers. Star Wars: Hunters will be free to download for the Nintendo Switch, on the App Store and on Google Play in 2021.
Star Wars: Hunters is as a competitive arena combat game, with multiplayer team-based confrontations. The game will features a cast of new characters.

The game was first mentioned on August 18, 2018, when Zynga and Disney reached a deal regarding the development of a new Star Wars mobile game, with NaturalMotion starting development soon after, with the help of their subsidiaries BossAlien. On November 16, 2020, Zynga announced the creation of a new dedicated game studio in Austin, Texas, USA. The game was then mentioned again on February 10, 2021, in Zynga's Q4 2020 earning reports, before being properly announced several days later on February 17, 2021, conjointly during a Nintendo Direct livestream, and on StarWars.com.
